sentences.sContent: The party’s share of the electorate has diminished steadily.
sentences.sCn: 支持这个政党的选民比例持续下降。

sentences.sContent: These drugs diminish blood flow to the brain.
sentences.sCn: 这些药物会减少流向脑部的血液量。

sentences.sContent: ...but they also tend to diminish their careers...

remMethod.val: di ＋ mini(小) ＋ (i)sh(使) → 变少， 减少

words.tran: 暗淡的，昏暗的；模糊的，看不清的；悲观的，怀疑的
使暗淡，使失去光泽；使变模糊

trans.tranOther: to become or make something become smaller or less

trans.tranCn: 减少， 减小， 降低
